Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw and label a variety of habitats, such as a forest and a pond, clearly differentiating between them.

The student can illustrate a diverse array of living things within each habitat, including detailed representations of plants (trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants) and animals (lizards, squirrels, ants in the forest; fish, frogs, ducks in the pond).
The student can effectively compare and depict at least two different habitats in their drawing, showing the diversity and distinctiveness of both plant and animal life.
The student can identify and accurately show patterns, such as similar types of plants (such as grasses) or animals (such as small insects) that appear in both habitats.
CANNOT: The student might occasionally omit labels for some plants or animals due to oversight, though they mostly understand the task.
The student may struggle to depict the scale accurately, displaying some plants or animals larger or smaller than they should be relative to the habitat.
